io.github.nucleuspowered.nucleus.api.service

Interface NucleusModuleService


  • public interface NucleusModuleService
    A service that allows plugins to request certain modules are not loaded.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canDisableModules()
      Returns whether modules can be disabled.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getModulesToLoad()
      Gets the ids of the modules to load, or the modules that have been loaded.
      void removeModule(java.lang.String module, java.lang.Object plugin)
      Removes a module from NucleusPlugin programmatically, so plugins can override the behaviour if required.

    • Method Detail

      • getModulesToLoad

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getModulesToLoad()
        Gets the ids of the modules to load, or the modules that have been loaded.
        Returns:
        The modules that are to be loaded, or are being loaded.

      • canDisableModules

        boolean canDisableModules()
        Returns whether modules can be disabled.
        Returns:
        true if so.

      • removeModule

        void removeModule(java.lang.String module,
                  java.lang.Object plugin)
           throws ModulesLoadedException,
                  UnremovableModuleException,
                  NoModuleException
        Removes a module from NucleusPlugin programmatically, so plugins can override the behaviour if required. This method will only work during pre-init and init - while canDisableModules() is true.
        Parameters:
        module - The id of the module to disable.
        plugin - The plugin that is requesting to disable the module. Used for logging purposes - telling the user who is disabling the plugin.
        Throws:
        ModulesLoadedException - Thrown if the modules have now been loaded and can no longer be removed.
        UnremovableModuleException - Thrown if the module has been marked "cannot be disabled". Plugins are expected to honour this, NucleusPlugin does not mark any module (apart from the core) as "unable to be disabled" by default, so plugin authors are requested to not try to override any behaviour that a user has explicitly turned on.
        NoModuleException - Thrown if the module does not exist.
